alert.note: Alert for Hickman (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 08 at 8:55AM CST until December 13 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Duck River At Centerville affecting Hickman County. .Periods of heavy rainfall have cause the Duck River at Centerville to rise above action stage. At 17 feet river will begin to overflow the banks and possible impact local roadways. For the Duck River...including Manchester, Shelbyville, Pottsville, Milltown, Columbia, Centerville, Hurricane Mills...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Duck River At Centerville. * WHEN...From this morning to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Flood waters will cover the flood plain along the river. Several roads near the river will be partially covered. In Centerville, Hickman Springs Road and Defeated Creek Road will be affected. Leatherwood Road between Shady Grove and Primm Springs near Tottys Bend will also be affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 17.2 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.5 feet tomorrow evening. - Action stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM CST.
